name.japanese: アマゾン・リリー宮殿

keyEvents.title: Nyon Diagnoses Hancock
keyEvents.description: Nyon visits Hancock's chambers in the palace and diagnoses her love sickness.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the truth about Hancock's feelings is revealed.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Meets Luffy
keyEvents.description: Hancock rushes through the palace to meet Luffy after hearing he wants to see her.
keyEvents.significance: The palace serves as the setting for Hancock and Luffy's important conversation.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Agrees to Help
keyEvents.description: In the palace, Hancock agrees to help Luffy rescue Ace.
keyEvents.significance: The decision that launches the next phase of the story is made here.

description: The royal palace of Amazon Lily where Empress Boa Hancock resides. It serves as the seat of power for the Kuja tribe and is located in the heart of the island.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Departs Amazon Lily
keyEvents.description: Hancock leaves Amazon Lily for the first time in years to help Luffy.
keyEvents.significance: This departure marks a major change for both Hancock and the island, as she leaves to cure her love sickness.

description: An island in the Calm Belt inhabited exclusively by the Kuja tribe of women warriors. It is ruled by Empress Boa Hancock and is home to the Kuja Pirates. Men are forbidden on the island.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Boards the Ship
keyEvents.description: Hancock boards Vice Admiral Momonga's Marine ship, leaving Amazon Lily behind.
keyEvents.significance: This ship becomes the vessel that transports both Hancock and the hidden Luffy toward Impel Down.

keyEvents.title: Marines Unfrozen
keyEvents.description: Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to unfreeze the Marines aboard the ship.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Hancock's cooperation and allows the ship to proceed to Marine Headquarters.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Hides Aboard
keyEvents.description: Luffy hides beneath Hancock's robe on the Marine ship, beginning his infiltration mission.
keyEvents.significance: The ship unknowingly carries both a Warlord and one of the most wanted pirates toward Impel Down.

description: A Marine battleship commanded by Vice Admiral Momonga. The ship was sent to Amazon Lily to summon Hancock to participate in the war effort. It becomes the vessel that carries both Hancock and the hidden Luffy toward Impel Down.

statusHistory.description: Crew was petrified by Hancock's powers
Crew unfrozen and ship proceeding to Marine Headquarters

keyEvents.title: Sengoku Learns of Whitebeard's Mobilization
keyEvents.description: At Marine Headquarters, Sengoku receives news that the Whitebeard Pirates are mobilizing for war.
keyEvents.significance: The command center where war preparations are being coordinated.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe's Imprisonment Revealed
keyEvents.description: Sengoku discusses how Jinbe was sent to Impel Down for refusing to fight Whitebeard.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the headquarters' response to the Warlord's defection.

description: The main headquarters of the Marines and the center of Marine military operations. Led by Fleet Admiral Sengoku, it coordinates the response to the threat posed by Whitebeard's attempt to rescue Ace.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe Imprisoned
keyEvents.description: Jinbe is mentioned as being sent to Impel Down for refusing to fight Whitebeard.
keyEvents.significance: First mention of Jinbe's imprisonment at Impel Down.

keyEvents.title: Garp Visits Ace
keyEvents.description: Monkey D. Garp arrives at Impel Down to visit his imprisoned grandson Ace.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Ace's current location and the emotional weight of his imprisonment.

description: The World Government's maximum-security prison located in the Calm Belt. It houses the world's most dangerous criminals, including Portgas D. Ace who awaits execution. The prison is destination for Luffy's infiltration mission.
